instructions: Turn on NFC on your device. From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap NFC . Tap the NFC switch ON . Place the rear of your phone against the rear of the other device or against the printed tag. Your device should vibrate or sound a confirmation depending on the settings. If necessary, follow any prompts (for example, if you are receiving a contact, you must select where to save the contact).
From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Tap NFC . Tap the NFC switch ON .

Turn on and connect to Wi-Fi From any home screen, tap Apps . Tap Settings . Under CONNECT AND SHARE , tap Nearby devices . Tap the Nearby Devices switch to the ON/OFF position. If streaming is on, under ADVANCED , tap each section to share: Content to share Videos Photos Music Allowed devices Denied devices Download to Device SD card Receive files from other phones Always accept Always ask Always reject
From any home screen tap the recent application icon (bottom left corner). Scroll and select application you want to close. Swipe left or right to close selected application .
From any Home screen, tap the Apps icon . Tap Settings . Scroll down to 'System,' and then tap Storage . Under 'Device memory,' view the Available space value.
